name: Creedence Clearwater Revival Lyrics Quiz | Music | 20 Questions

questions.text: 'Just about a year ago, I set out on the road,'
'Now, when I was just a little boy, standin' to my Daddy's knee,'
'Left a good job in the city, workin' for The Man ev'ry night and day,'
'Just got home from Illinois, lock the front door, oh boy! Got to sit down, take a rest on the porch.'
'I like the way you walk, I like the way you talk'
'Someone told me long ago there's a calm before the storm, I know; It's been comin' for some time.'
'Early in the evenin' just about supper time, over by the courthouse they're starting to unwind.'
'Some folks are born made to wave the flag, Ooh, they're red, white and blue'
'Well, take me back down where cool water flows, yeah. Let me remember things I love'
'Oo, Bet you're wond'ring how I knew 'bout your plans to make me blue'
'Put a candle in the window, 'cause I feel I've got to move.'
questions.correct: 'Long As I Can See the Light'
questions.explanation: 'Long As I Can See the Light'.

questions.text: 'Well, you wake up in the mornin', you hear the work bell ring,'
'Was Ridin' along side the highway, rollin' up the country side.'
'Seven Thirty Seven comin' out of the sky. Oh! Won't you take me down to Memphis on a midnight ride,'
'There's a place up ahead and I'm goin' just as fast as my feet can fly'
What song starts with 'When I was a little bitty baby my mama would rock me in the cradle'?
'On the highway, Thirty people lost their lives.'
'Maybe you don't understand it. But if you're a natural man,'
'The sun came up and pushed away the clouds.'
'Whoa, thought it was a nightmare, Lo, it's all so true,'
